intro: Discanthera dissecta, commonly known as the dissected grass-vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves that are finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Discanthera dissecta is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
